data.title: PEOPLES BANCORP INC SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Peoples Bancorp Inc., a community-focused financial services company, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights the company's financial performance and operational activities for the three months ended September 30, 2025. Despite facing some challenges, the company has demonstrated stable financial performance and continues to focus on maintaining strong credit quality and managing interest rate risk.

Financial Highlights

  • Total Interest Income: $132.8 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, reflecting a slight decrease from $133.6 million in the same period in 2024, indicating stable interest income performance.
  • Net Interest Income: $91.3 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to $88.9 million in the same period in 2024, showing a modest increase due to effective interest rate management.
  • Provision for Credit Losses: $7.3 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, up from $6.7 million in the same period in 2024, reflecting a cautious approach to credit risk.
  • Net Interest Income After Provision for Credit Losses: $84.1 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to $82.2 million in the same period in 2024, indicating a stable net interest margin.
  • Total Non-Interest Income: $23.8 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, slightly down from $24.8 million in the same period in 2024, due to lower mortgage banking income.
  • Total Non-Interest Expense: $69.9 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, up from $66.1 million in the same period in 2024, driven by increased salaries and employee benefit costs.
  • Income Before Income Taxes: $38.0 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to $40.9 million in the same period in 2024, reflecting a slight decrease due to higher non-interest expenses.
  • Net Income: $29.5 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, down from $31.7 million in the same period in 2024, primarily due to increased provision for credit losses and non-interest expenses.
  • Earnings Per Common Share - Basic: $0.83 for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to $0.90 in the same period in 2024, reflecting the impact of lower net income.
  • Earnings Per Common Share - Diluted: $0.83 for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to $0.89 in the same period in 2024, consistent with the basic earnings per share trend.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments: The company reported revenue from various segments including electronic banking, trust and investment services, insurance, and mortgage banking. Electronic banking income was $18,695 for the nine months ended September 30, 2025, while trust and investment income was $15,756 for the same period.
  • Future Outlook: Management indicated a focus on maintaining strong credit quality and managing interest rate risk. The company plans to continue leveraging its community banking model to drive growth and profitability.

SEC Filing: PEOPLES BANCORP INC [ PEBO ] - 10-Q - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: Hilton Grand Vacations Inc. SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Hilton Grand Vacations Inc., a leading global timeshare company, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report provides a comprehensive overview of the company's financial and operational performance, highlighting stable revenue streams and consistent profitability despite slight declines in some key metrics. The company continues to operate through its main segments, Real Estate Sales and Financing, and Resort Operations and Club Management, with a strong geographical presence across multiple regions.

Financial Highlights

  • Total Revenues: $1,300 million, reflecting a slight decrease from $1,306 million in the same period last year, indicating stable sales performance.
  • Net Income: $30 million, a slight decrease from $32 million in the same period last year, showing consistent profitability.
  • Net Income Attributable to Stockholders: $25 million, compared to $29 million in the same period last year, indicating a slight decline in earnings available to shareholders.
  • Basic EPS: $0.28, consistent with the same period last year, reflecting stable earnings per share.
  • Diluted EPS: $0.28, consistent with the same period last year, indicating stable diluted earnings per share.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments: Hilton Grand Vacations operates through two main segments: Real Estate Sales and Financing, and Resort Operations and Club Management. The Real Estate Sales and Financing segment includes sales of vacation ownership intervals (VOIs) and related financing, while the Resort Operations and Club Management segment includes club management, resort management, and rental activities.
  • Geographical Performance: The company has over 200 properties located in the United States, Europe, Canada, the Caribbean, Mexico, and Asia, with significant concentrations in Florida, Europe, Hawaii, South Carolina, California, Arizona, Virginia, and Nevada.
  • Sales Units: The Real Estate Sales and Financing segment reported sales of VOIs, net, amounting to $473 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, and $1,320 million for the nine months ended September 30, 2025.
  • Future Outlook: The company expects to recognize revenue, costs of VOI sales, and direct selling costs related to projects under construction upon their completion in 2026. Additionally, the company is evaluating the impact of recent accounting standards updates on its financial statements and disclosures.

SEC Filing: Hilton Grand Vacations Inc. [ HGV ] - 10-Q - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: FMC CORP SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
FMC Corp, a leading global agricultural sciences company, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report reveals significant financial and operational changes, driven by strategic decisions and market conditions, particularly in the company's India business. This summary provides an overview of the key financial and business highlights from the report.

Financial Highlights

Revenue: FMC Corp reported revenue of $542.2 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, a significant decrease from $1,065.4 million in the same period of 2024. This decline was primarily due to one-time commercial actions related to the India business.

Gross Margin: The gross margin for the third quarter of 2025 was $128.9 million, compared to $386.4 million in the same period of 2024, indicating a substantial decline in profitability.

Income (loss) from continuing operations before income taxes: The company reported a loss of $(466.0) million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, down from $72.5 million in the same period of 2024. This was driven by restructuring and impairment charges.

Net Income (loss): FMC Corp reported a net loss of $(568.6) million for the third quarter of 2025, compared to a net income of $65.6 million in the same period of 2024. The loss was largely impacted by the India business adjustments and restructuring costs.

Net income (loss) attributable to FMC stockholders: The net loss attributable to FMC stockholders was $(569.3) million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, versus a net income of $65.0 million in the same period of 2024, reflecting the adverse effects of strategic divestitures and market conditions.

Basic earnings (loss) per common share attributable to FMC stockholders: The basic loss per share was $(4.52) for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to earnings of $0.52 in the same period of 2024, highlighting the impact of significant charges and lower revenue.

Diluted earnings (loss) per common share attributable to FMC stockholders: The diluted loss per share was $(4.52) for the three months ended September 30, 2025, versus earnings of $0.52 in the same period of 2024, consistent with the basic earnings per share due to the net loss position.

Business Highlights

Revenue Segments: FMC Corp reported revenue from three major agricultural product categories: insecticides, herbicides, and fungicides. Insecticides generated $204.4 million in the third quarter of 2025, while herbicides and fungicides contributed $219.9 million and $89.3 million, respectively. Plant Health, which includes biological products, accounted for $35.2 million.

Geographical Performance: The North American region reported $244.4 million in revenue for the third quarter of 2025, showing a slight increase from the previous year. Latin America experienced a decline, with revenue at $463.1 million compared to $504.1 million in 2024. The EMEA region saw an increase to $154.5 million from $139.3 million. Asia reported a significant negative impact due to one-time commercial actions in India, resulting in a revenue charge of $419 million.

India Business Divestiture: FMC Corp is in the process of divesting its commercial business in India, which has been classified as held for sale. This decision was made in response to ongoing commercial challenges in the country. The sale is expected to conclude within the next twelve months.

Operational Adjustments in India: The company undertook several one-time commercial actions to prepare the India business for sale, including product returns and pricing changes, which resulted in a $282.2 million impact on operating results.

Future Outlook: FMC Corp is focusing on optimizing its footprint and organizational structure through Project Focus, a global restructuring plan initiated in response to market demand challenges. This includes right-sizing the cost base and optimizing the supply chain footprint.

Currency Impact: The company incurred $7.7 million in currency-related charges due to actions by the Argentine Government, impacting the financial results for the third quarter of 2025.

SEC Filing: FMC CORP [ FMC ] - 10-Q - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: Dream Finders Homes, Inc. SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Dream Finders Homes, Inc., a prominent homebuilding company, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report provides a comprehensive overview of the company's financial and operational performance, reflecting the challenges and achievements in the homebuilding industry amidst a fluctuating economic landscape.

Financial Highlights

  • Total Revenues: $969.8 million, decreased by 4% compared to the same period last year due to a decline in homebuilding revenues.
  • Homebuilding Gross Margin: $160.7 million, representing a 17.5% margin, down from 19.2% in the prior year, primarily due to increased sales incentives and higher land and financing costs.
  • Income Before Taxes: $60.8 million, a decrease of 34% from the previous year, driven by lower homebuilding revenues and gross margin.
  • Net Income: $47.1 million, down from $71.6 million in the prior year, reflecting the challenges in the homebuilding segment.
  • Diluted EPS: $0.47, compared to $0.70 in the previous year, indicating a decrease in earnings per share due to reduced net income.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments:
    • The Southeast segment reported homebuilding revenues of $317 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, an increase of 8% from the same period in 2024, driven by a 20% increase in home closings.
    • The Mid-Atlantic segment experienced a 15% decrease in homebuilding revenues to $242 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, primarily due to a 9% decrease in average sales price and a 5% decrease in home closings.
    • The Midwest segment saw a 13% decrease in homebuilding revenues to $357 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025, attributed to an 8% decrease in home closings and a 5% decrease in average sales price.
  • Geographical Performance:
    • The Southeast segment's growth was supported by the Liberty Communities acquisition, contributing $48 million in homebuilding revenues and 139 home closings with an average sales price of $348,231.
    • The Mid-Atlantic segment's decline in revenue was driven by decreased average sales prices and lower home closings, with a significant impact from increased sales incentives and higher financing costs.
    • The Midwest segment's revenue decline was due to strategic changes in product offerings, resulting in lower average sales prices and home closings.
  • Sales Units:
    • Total home closings increased by 26 units to 1,915 for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to the same period in 2024.
    • For the nine months ended September 30, 2025, home closings increased by 497 units to 6,072, reflecting a 9% increase compared to the same period in 2024.
  • New Product Launches: Sales began in the southwest Florida division during the three months ended September 30, 2025, contributing to organic growth in the Southeast segment.
  • Future Outlook: The company remains focused on its land-light strategy and operational improvements, with a positive long-term outlook on housing demand despite current macroeconomic challenges.

SEC Filing: Dream Finders Homes, Inc. [ DFH ] - 10-Q - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: CNX Resources Corp reports results for the quarter ended September 30 - Earnings Summary
data.description:
• CNX Resources Corp reported quarterly adjusted earnings of 49 cents​​ per share for the quarter ended September 30, higher than the same quarter last year, when the company reported EPS of 41 cents. The mean expectation of fourteen analysts for the quarter was for earnings of 33 cents per share. Wall Street expected results to range from 11 cents to 54 cents per share.

  • Revenue rose 37.6% to $583.84 million from a year ago; analysts expected $457.77 million.

  • CNX Resources Corp's reported EPS for the quarter was $1.21​.

  • The company reported quarterly net income of $202.1 million.

  • CNX Resources Corp shares had fallen by 1.1% this quarter and lost 13.4% so far this year.

FORECAST CHANGES

  • The mean earnings estimate of analysts had fallen by about 22.9% in the last three months.​

  • In the last 30 days, six analysts negatively revised earnings estimates

RECOMMENDATIONS

  • The current average analyst rating on the shares is "hold" and the breakdown of recommendations is 1 "strong buy" or "buy," 9 "hold" and 5 "sell" or "strong sell." The average consensus recommendation for the oil & gas exploration and production peer group is "buy."

  • Wall Street's median 12-month price target for CNX Resources Corp is $32.00, about 0.7% above its last closing price of $31.77

This summary was machine generated from LSEG data October 30 at 06:13 p.m. UTC. ​All figures in US dollars unless otherwise stated. data.title: Hershey's Halloween sales have disappointed, but there's hope for last-minute buying
data.description:
By Steve Gelsi

Chocolate giant says seasonal sales started slower than expected, but overall Halloween participation should pick up to be in line with last year

Hershey said Halloween sales have been soft this year but last-minute buying is expected to bring the business up to 2024 levels.

Hershey Co. said Thursday that candy buying ahead of Halloween has been disappointing so far, as warmer weather and a Friday holiday have people waiting until the last minute to go shopping.

The company (HSY) said that the seasonal tradition remains important to consumers, and it expects purchasing to pick up, bringing sales in line with last year.

"While Hershey's Halloween performance has been disappointing, the softness is not broad-based across our business," said Chief Executive Kirk Tanner.

A strong launch of the Reese's Oreo product and a rebound in chocolate sales have prompted Hershey's to raise its outlook for full-year, year-over-year sales growth to about 3% from at least 2%. And so far this year, Hershey said its chocolate retail sales have returned to growth, they have increased 4% after a previous 1% decline in 2024.

Still, the stock dropped 3.8% in morning trading, toward the lowest prices seen since mid-July.

During the third quarter, Reese's Oreo was the "top new item" in the candy, mint and gum category, the company said, with retail-sales trends exceeding targets.

The Reese's Oreo

"Early data shows that Reese's Oreo overindexes with Gen Z and millennial buyers, a priority audience for the brand," Tanner said. The company is preparing fresh advertising and partnerships to raise the confectionery's profile on Instagram, TikTok and through live events.

Overall, net sales for the third quarter increased 6.5% from a year ago to $3.18 billion, ahead of the FactSet consensus revenue estimate of $3.12 billion.

While Hershey has managed to boost prices, and as tariff costs have declined, the extra revenue "only partially mitigates" inflation from higher cocoa costs, which are still about 70% above levels in 2023.

Hershey said it expects cocoa prices to come down over time, with a larger global supply surplus expected for the 2025 and 2026 crop thanthe prior season.

Third-quarter net income fell to $276.3 million from $446.3 million in the year-ago quarter, while adjusted earnings per share of $1.30 handily beat the FactSet consensus EPS estimate of $1.07.

The company raised its outlook for 2025 EPS to between $5.90 and $6 from a range of $5.81 to $6. That compares with the analyst EPS projection of $6.02 a share, and with the year-ago level of $9.37 a share.

The selloff in Hershey's stock has turned it negative for the year. It has now slipped 0.4% in 2025, while the S&P 500 index SPX has advanced 16.4%.

-Steve Gelsi

This content was created by MarketWatch, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. MarketWatch is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.

data.title: Options traders primed for immense market swings when the S&P 500 hits 7,000
data.description:
Key points:
  • Nasdaq down ~1%, S&P 500 declines ~0.5%; Dow up ~0.2%
  • Cons Disc weakest S&P 500 sector; Real Estate leads gainers
  • Dollar rallies; gold up ~2; crude edges up; bitcoin off >3.5%
  • US 10-Year Treasury yield rises to ~4.10%

OPTIONS TRADERS PRIMED FOR IMMENSE MARKET SWINGS WHEN THE S&P 500 HITS 7,000

With the benchmark S&P 500 not far below the 7,000 mark, analysts at J.P.Morgan highlighted that option traders might be positioned to spur additional volatility in the market.

J.P. Morgan's Ilan Benhamou said in a note dated October 29 that dealers will turn to being "short gamma" once the S&P 500 breaches 7,000 points, meaning that dealers will have to buy as the market goes higher, potentially triggering a sharp squeeze once it reaches that level.

In a short gamma position, dealers typically sell stock futures during market declines and purchase them during rallies, intensifying price movements in both directions.

As of Thursday afternoon, the S&P 500, at around 6,855, sits 145 points, or just 2% away from the 7,000 milestone, which would mark a record high for the U.S. benchmark.

(Shashwat Chauhan, Saqib Ahmed)

*****

data.title: Recover Investment Losses: Class Action Initiated Against Baxter International, Inc. (BAX)
data.description:
NEW YORK, NY / ACCESS Newswire / October 30, 2025 / If you suffered a loss on your Baxter International, Inc. investment and want to learn about a potential recovery under the federal securities laws, follow the link below for more information:

https://zlk.com/pslra-1/baxter-international-inc-lawsuit-submission-form?prid=174787&wire=1&utm_campaign=24

or contact Joseph E. Levi, Esq. via email at jlevi@levikorsinsky.com or call (212) 363-7500 to speak to our team of experienced shareholder advocates.

THE LAWSUIT: A class action securities lawsuit was filed against Baxter International, Inc. that seeks to recover losses of shareholders who were adversely affected by alleged securities fraud between February 23, 2022 and July 30, 2025.

CASE DETAILS: The filed complaint alleges that defendants made false statements and/or concealed that: (a) Baxter's recently launched product, the Novum LVP, suffered systemic defects that caused widespread malfunctions, including under infusion, over infusion, and complete non-delivery of fluids, which exposed patients to risks of serious injury or death; (b) Baxter was notified of multiple device malfunctions, injuries, and deaths from these defects; (c) Baxter's attempts to address these defects through customer alerts were inadequate remedial measures, when design flaws persisted and continued to cause serious harm to patients; (d) as a result, there was a heightened risk that customers would be instructed to take existing Novum LVPs out of service and that Baxter would completely pause all new sales of these pumps; and (e) based on the foregoing, Baxter's statements about the safety, efficacy, product rollout, customer feedback and sales prospects of the Novum LVPs were materially false and misleading.

WHAT'S NEXT? If you suffered a loss in Baxter International, Inc. stock during the relevant time frame - even if you still hold your shares - go to https://zlk.com/pslra-1/baxter-international-inc-lawsuit-submission-form?prid=174787&wire=1&utm_campaign=24 to learn about your rights to seek a recovery. There is no cost or obligation to participate.

WHY LEVI & KORSINSKY: Over the past 20 years, Levi & Korsinsky LLP has established itself as a nationally-recognized securities litigation firm that has secured hundreds of millions of dollars for aggrieved shareholders and built a track record of winning high-stakes cases. The firm has extensive expertise representing investors in complex securities litigation and a team of over 70 employees to serve our clients. For seven years in a row, Levi & Korsinsky has ranked in ISS Securities Class Action Services' Top 50 Report as one of the top securities litigation firms in the United States. Attorney Advertising. Prior results do not guarantee similar outcomes.

CONTACT:

Levi & Korsinsky, LLP

New York, NY 10004

data.title: Citycon Q1-Q3/2025 interim results: consistent operational performance. Hilik Attias appointed as the CFO of Citycon.
data.description:
Citycon Oyj

CITYCON OYJ    Interim Report    30 October 2025 at 20:15 hrs

  Strong operational performance in Q1-Q3/2025

-          Like-for-like net rental income increased by 5.7% and 6.8% in Q3/2025.

-          Retail average rent per sq.m. increased by 3.9% with comparable FX to EUR 27.5 per sq.m (vs. Q3/2024).

-          Retail economic occupancy rate 95.2% (vs. 95.1% in Q3/2024).

-          Like-for-like footfall increased 1.5%.

-          Like-for-like tenant sales increased 1.4%.

-          Fair value net gain of investment properties in Q1–Q3/2025 was EUR 42.8 million.

-          In Q3/2025 fair value net gain of investment properties was EUR 8.6 million.

Proactive debt management

Q1-Q2/2025

-          In Q1-Q2/2025 Citycon completed in total over EUR 730 million debt repayments.

-          LTV (IFRS) decreased -90 basis points during Q1-Q2/2025 to 46.4% (Q4/2024: 47.3%).

Q3/2025

-          Citycon completed the share buy-back programme and the repurchase of the company’s own shares, the share repurchases started on 23 June 2025 and ended on 11 July 2025. Citycon repurchased a total of 694,801 own shares corresponding to approximately EUR 2.6 million.

-          In August Citycon tendered around EUR 35 million of its hybrid bonds (EUR 34 million of the 2024 notes and EUR 1 million of the 2019 notes).

-          LTV (IFRS) increased 50 basis points during Q3/2025 to 46.9% (Q2/2025: 46.4%).

Post Q3/2025

-          In October Citycon extended its committed Revolving credit facility until October 2029 (with an additional one-year extension option) from current April 2027 and increased the amount to EUR 250 million from EUR 200 million. The facility is undrawn by end of Q3/2025.

KEY FIGURES

  • 1) Change from previous year (comparable exchange rates). Change-% is calculated from exact figures.

  • 2) Citycon presents alternative performance measures according to the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) guidelines. Citycon follows updated EPRA Best Practices Recommendations (BPR) in its reporting starting from the beginning of 2025. More information is presented in section EPRA performance measures.

  • 3) The key figure includes hybrid bond interests, amortized fees and gains/losses and expenses on hybrid bond repayments.

  • 4) From the beginning of 2025 the key figure includes hybrid bond interests and excludes reorganisation and one-time costs. The information for the comparison periods has been restated to correspond to the new reporting recommendations.

  • 5) A new key figure introduced at the beginning of 2025. The key figure excludes hybrid bond interests and reorganisation and one-time costs.

  • 6) The development of currency rates improved EPRA NRV/share by EUR 0.05.

  • 7) The numbers include the impact of divestments executed during 2024.

 

CEO ESHEL PESTI:

We delivered solid performance during the first nine months of 2025, like-for-like net rental income growth was 5.7% compared to same period last year in comparable FX. This growth was supported by higher retail economic occupancy rate and rental uplifts. Footfall and tenant sales also showed positive momentum, rising by 1.5% and 1.4% respectively during Q1-Q3/2025 compared to last year. Net rental income margin was solid at 94.0% in Q1-Q3/2025. Further, we had a significant, 22% reduction in administrative expenses in Q1-Q3/2025 compared to last year.

The positive trend accelerated in the third quarter of the year, where like-for-like net rental income grew by 6.8% compared to the same period previous year in comparable FX. The strong result was driven by improving retail economic occupancy rate which grew by 20 basis points quarter-on-quarter to 95.2% in Q3/2025, while footfall and tenant sales increased by 2.8% and 1.6% respectively in Q3/2025 compared to previous year.

These results demonstrate the continued attractiveness of our assets and the effectiveness of our operational strategy which was reflected in fair value gains of our portfolio. In Q3/2025 we recognized fair value gains of EUR 8.6 million and during the first nine months fair value gains reached EUR 42.8 million. We also continued our proactive debt management in Q3/2025 as we completed a hybrid bond tender for around EUR 35 million. All in all, we have prepaid debt for over EUR 750 million during Q1-Q3/2025.

Our year 2025 outlook is tightened to:

  • EPRA Earnings per share EUR 0.41-0.46
  • EPRA Earnings per share excluding hybrid bond interests EUR 0.60-0.65

I have the privilege of having spent my first months as the CEO of Citycon. I have started by getting to know our people and our assets and I am pleased to say that we have both great people and high-quality assets. One of our first steps has been to shift focus more to country level. We are also continuing to implement measures to improve efficiency with emphasis on revenue growth and gaining better control over costs. Based on this our operational assumptions for year 2026 are built around two main components:

  • Like-for-like net rental income growth including specialty leasing above the consumer price index
  • G&A optimisation and operational cost reduction

On the financing side our focus continues to be on further strengthening and de-risking our balance sheet. Post Q3/2025 in October 2025 Citycon successfully completed a refinancing and extension of the committed Revolving credit facility. The new sustainability-linked facility matures in October 2029 with a potential one-year extension to October 2030. Further, the facility was increased from EUR 200 million to EUR 250 million.

OUTLOOK (specified 30 October 2025)

Current outlook

Previous outlook

EPRA Earnings per share (basic)

EUR

0.41-0.46

0.41-0.50

EPRA Earnings per share excluding hybrid bond interests (basic)

EUR

0.60-0.65

0.60-0.69

The outlook assumes that there are no major changes in macroeconomic factors and no major disruptions from the war in Ukraine. These estimates are based on the existing property portfolio as well as on the prevailing level of inflation, the EUR–SEK and EUR–NOK exchange rates, and current interest rates.

EPRA Earnings per share (basic) and EPRA Earnings per share excluding hybrid bond interests (basic) for 2025 are based on updated EPRA Best Practices Recommendations (BPR) Guidelines published on the 1st of October 2024 and are not fully comparable with previously reported EPRA EPS key figures.

AUDIOCAST

Citycon's live audiocast will be held on Friday, 31 October 2025 at 10:00 a.m. EET. The audiocast can be participated by calling in and following live on the following website:  https://citycon.events.inderes.com/q3-2025.

As Citycon’s CEO has just recently joined the company the management team will exceptionally not take live questions in the audiocast. However, we will continue our tradition of hosting a Q&A session during the full-year 2025 results audiocast, where the management team will be available to answer questions live. Potential questions for the management team can be sent by email to ir@citycon.com after the audiocast.

The audiocast will be recorded and it will be available afterwards on Citycon’s website.

HILIK ATTIAS APPOINTED AS CITYCON’S NEW CFO

The Board of Directors of Citycon Oyj has appointed Hilik Attias as Citycon’s new CFO and member of the Corporate Management Committee commencing on 1 November 2025. Mr Attias will be based at Citycon’s headquarters in Iso Omena, Espoo, Finland.

Mr Attias is an experienced executive with over 15 years of expertise in various roles within finance and a proven track record in securing funding for publicly listed real estate. Prior to joining Citycon he has served as the Vice President, Finance at G City Ltd.

The acting CFO Eero Sihvonen will step down from his role and leave the Corporate Management Committee on 31 October 2025. Mr Sihvonen will return to his role as a member the Board and will continue as an advisor to the management of the company until March 2026.

Eshel Pesti, CEO, Citycon: “I warmly welcome Hilik to Citycon. His background contains the two key elements of great value for us: experience in the listed real estate industry and financing. Hilik enters the big shoes of Eero, however I am confident that Hilik will succeed in his role as Citycon’s CFO. I also want to thank Eero for his total of 17 years in Citycon, his fingerprint is everywhere in the company. During the past year he has especially worked on securing our financing and strengthening Citycon’s balance sheet. His experience as the CFO of Citycon was valuable support for the company during this transition period.”

Hilik Attias, incoming CFO, Citycon: “I am excited to start in my new role at Citycon, the leading owner and developer of urban hubs in the Nordics. I look forward to contributing to the company’s future. Together with the professional team at Citycon we will continue the work to strengthen the company’s balance sheet.” 

CITYCON OYJ

For further information, please contact:

Eero Sihvonen

CFO

Tel. +358 50 557 9137

eero.sihvonen@citycon.com

Contact requests through:

Anni Torkko

Investor Relations Manager

Tel. +358 45 358 0570

anni.torkko@citycon.com

Citycon is a leading owner, manager and developer of mixed-use real estate featuring modern, necessity-based retail with residential, office and municipal service spaces that enhance the communities in which they operate. Citycon is committed to sustainable property management in the Nordic region with assets that total approximately EUR 3.8 billion. Our centres are located in urban hubs in the heart of vibrant communities with direct connections to public transport and anchored by grocery, healthcare and other services that cater to the everyday needs of customers.

Citycon’s shares are listed on Nasdaq Helsinki Ltd.

www.citycon.com  

https://news.cision.com/citycon-oyj/r/citycon-q1-q3-2025-interim-results--consistent-operational-performance--hilik-attias-appointed-as-th%2Cc4259531

Citycon 2025 Q1-Q3 Interim Report

data.title: American Electric Power Is Maintained at Overweight by Morgan Stanley
Brazilian court grants bankruptcy protection to Ambipar
data.description:
A Rio de Janeiro court approved on Thursday Brazilian waste management company Ambipar's request for bankruptcy protection, the decision showed.

Ambipar said in a statement that the court decision is an "important step" toward its operational restructuring, as it allows the firm to preserve more than 23,000 jobs and implement measures to balance its finances.

According to the statement, the company's financial liabilities total approximately 10.5 billion reais ($1.94 billion).

The decision also initiates a 180-day stay period, during which all financial collections and enforcement actions against the company are suspended.

"During this phase, Ambipar will present its judicial recovery plan, which will define the conditions, stages, and schedule for the restructuring process," the company added.

Ambipar and its U.S.-listed subsidiary had filed for bankruptcy protection earlier this month after a turbulent period for the firm.

The bankruptcy move followed a cash crunch and the risk of accelerated debt repayments worth billions of reais.

($1 = 5.4039 reais)

Mexico gov't sees 2025 fiscal deficit just above 4% of GDP, in line with forecasts
data.description:
Mexican Finance Minister Edgar Amador said on Thursday he expects the country's fiscal deficit to land between 4.3%-4.4% of gross domestic product this year, in line with estimates in the government's recent budget report.

Public debt for the end of September stood at 49.9% of GDP, Amador said in a quarterly economic presentation, compared to 49.5% reported for the end of June.

data.title: Canadian dollar weakens as Fed re-pricing runs its course
data.description:
Key points:
  • Canadian dollar falls 0.3% against the greenback
  • Trades in a range of 1.3928 to 1.4014
  • Price of oil increases 0.5%
  • 10-year yield pulls back from a near three-week high

By Fergal Smith

The Canadian dollar weakened against its U.S. counterpart on Thursday as the greenback posted broad-based gains, but the move was limited as the boost to the U.S. currency from a more hawkish Federal Reserve began to fade.

The loonie was trading 0.3% lower at 1.3980 per U.S. dollar, or 71.53 U.S. cents, after moving in a range of 1.3928 to 1.4014.

"We saw USD-CAD briefly trade above the 1.4000 threshold today as the market continued to re-price Fed rate expectations after a more hawkish tone from Fed Chair Powell yesterday," said George Davis, chief technical strategist at RBC Capital Markets.

"With that largely running its course, we’ve come off of the highs ... The USD remains relatively firm, so it feels like USD/CAD will find some support near 1.3950."

The U.S. dollar rose against a basket of major currencies as the Bank of Japan adopted a less hawkish tone than traders expected. On Wednesday, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said an interest rate cut in December was not guaranteed, giving the greenback a boost.

The Bank of Canada also gave guidance on Wednesday that was more hawkish than expected. The bank signaled a potential end to its easing campaign after lowering its benchmark rate to a three-year low of 2.25%.

Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney will meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday in South Korea. Carney arrived in Asia earlier this week in an effort to deepen trade and security ties in the region, at a time when Canada is struggling to lessen its dependence on the U.S. and seek new markets.

The price of oil , one of Canada's major exports, rose 0.5% to $60.75 a barrel as investors assessed a potential trade truce between the United States and China.

The Canadian 10-year yield (CA10YT=RR) pulled back from an earlier near three-week high at 3.181% to trade 2.5 basis points lower at 3.133%.

data.title: Can Democrats find their footing? Tight New Jersey governor's race tests Trump's pull
data.description:
Key points:
  • Polls: Democrat Sherrill edges Republican Ciattarelli
  • Democrats have two-to-one advantage in voter registration
  • Trump made gains in state in 2024 presidential election
  • Obama will rally alongside Sherrill on Saturday

By Joseph Ax

The closely contested New Jersey governor's race between Democrat Mikie Sherrill and Republican Jack Ciattarelli has set new spending records and drawn political heavyweights, as both national parties seek an early gauge of voter sentiment nine months into Republican President Donald Trump's term.

New Jersey and Virginia are the only states holding gubernatorial elections on Tuesday. Democrats, locked out of power in Washington, are hoping a clean sweep can provide a burst of momentum ahead of next year's midterm battle for control of Congress.

The focus on New Jersey has been especially intense, after the state swung toward Trump by a greater margin from 2020 to 2024 than all but one other state. The Republican and Democratic gubernatorial campaign arms have funneled more than $34 million into the general election, according to campaign finance records, helping fuel what is projected to be in excess of $200 million spent on the election including the primary contests.

Sherrill, a 53-year-old congresswoman and former Navy helicopter pilot, has held a small but steady single-digit lead in opinion polls over Ciattarelli, a 63-year-old former state assemblyman and small business owner who is mounting his third consecutive run for governor. Democratic Governor Phil Murphy cannot run for reelection after serving two four-year terms.

LEADING FIGURES TURN OUT TO RALLY SUPPORT

Both candidates seek to defy historical trends.

If Sherrill prevails, it will mark the first time in 60 years that New Jersey voters have elected a governor from the same party for three consecutive terms. Ciattarelli, meanwhile, would be only the second governor elected from the same party as the sitting president in the last nine elections.

While Democrats hold a two-to-one advantage in voter registration, Trump's merely six-point loss in 2024 and Ciattarelli's own surprisingly narrow three-point defeat to Murphy in 2021 have given Republicans hope of an upset.

"Sherrill definitely has a lead, but it is not an insurmountable one,” said Micah Rasmussen, the director of the Rebovich Institute for New Jersey Politics at Rider University in New Jersey. “Either Sherrill or Ciattarelli could win.”

Most high-quality polls have shown Sherrill with a lead of five to eight percentage points, according to a tracker maintained by the New York Times, though an Emerson College/PIX11/The Hill survey released on Thursday gave Sherrill only a 49%-48% lead with 2% undecided.

A Sherrill loss in Democratic-leaning New Jersey would represent a significant blow to the party. The Democratic National Committee, which hosted a get-out-the-vote call with Sherrill and Virginia Democratic gubernatorial candidate Abigail Spanberger on Wednesday, has made record investments in both states.

In Virginia, Spanberger, 46, a former congresswoman and CIA officer, has held a comfortable lead in opinion polls over her opponent, Republican Lieutenant Governor Winsome Earle-Sears, 61.

New York City is also holding its mayoral election on Tuesday. State Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani, 33, whose nimble campaign has transformed him from a little-known lawmaker to a rising Democratic star, leads in polls over former Democratic Governor Andrew Cuomo, 67, and Republican Curtis Sliwa, 71.

Leading Democratic figures are campaigning with Sherrill in the closing weeks, including Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, former Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and Maryland Governor Wes Moore – all potential 2028 presidential candidates. Former President Barack Obama will rally alongside Sherrill on Saturday.

Trump, who endorsed Ciattarelli, held a tele-rally for the Republican before embarking on his current Asia trip.

The president has cast a shadow over the race. His administration froze funding for new Hudson River train tunnels to Manhattan to punish Democrats he blames for a long-running government shutdown – a major issue for New Jersey’s sizable commuter population.

Sherrill has used that decision to sharpen her argument that Ciattarelli is too beholden to Trump, pointing to Ciattarelli’s answer during a recent debate that he would give Trump an “A” grade thus far.

Ciattarelli, who distanced himself from Trump during his 2021 gubernatorial campaign, has moved closer to the president this cycle, though he has stopped short of a full MAGA transformation.

“He’s had to do quite a delicate dance this time around,” said Ashley Koning, the director of the Eagleton Center for Public Interest Polling at Rutgers University.

RACE TURNS TO PERSONAL ATTACKS

Ciattarelli has made a point of campaigning in urban areas that are traditionally more Democratic to try to replicate some of the gains Trump made with non-white voters, according to Mike DuHaime, a Republican strategist who advised former Governor Chris Christie’s campaigns.

“The greatest variable is whether or not Jack can get some of these Trump voters to come out in a non-presidential year,” he said. “Will those voters vote for someone who’s not Donald Trump?”

Both candidates have focused on how to make New Jersey, one of the most expensive states in the country, more affordable. Sherrill has tied Ciattarelli to Trump’s tariffs and to Republican cuts to healthcare, while Ciattarelli has blamed Murphy and his fellow Democrats for the high cost of living.

But the race has also taken a decidedly personal turn in recent weeks, with plenty of ad hominem attacks.

Ciattarelli has accused Sherrill of playing down her ties to a cheating scandal at the Naval Academy. She said she was barred from walking at her commencement ceremony because she would not turn in her classmates but was not directly involved.

“Well, this seems to be now the playbook of Republicans, just looking to attack anyone who's served,” Sherrill said at a recent campaign event in West Windsor, New Jersey.

Sherrill, meanwhile, has accused Ciattarelli of helping to cause opioid deaths through a medical publishing business he owned.

The Republican has called that a “baseless, reckless lie” and has vowed to file a defamation lawsuit against Sherrill.

data.description:

Thursday, 30 October 2025

The Character Group plc

("Character", the "Company" or the "Group")

Transaction in Own Shares

Character announces that, in accordance with the terms of its share buyback programme announced on 29 October 2024 and extended and increased as announced on 30 May 2025 (the "Programme"), the Company purchased a number of its issued ordinary shares of £0.05 each ("Ordinary Shares") from Panmure Liberum Limited ("Panmure Liberum") in accordance with the following particulars:

Date of purchase:

30 October 2025

Aggregate number of Ordinary Shares purchased:

6,400

Lowest price paid per share (GB pence):

274

Highest price paid per share (GB pence):

274

Volume weighted average price paid per share (GB pence):

274

The repurchased shares have been cancelled. Following the purchase of these shares, the Company holds 1,983,059 shares in treasury and has 17,809,699 shares in issue (excluding treasury shares). Therefore, the total voting rights in the Company will be 17,809,699. The figure of 17,809,699 may be used by shareholders as the denominator for the calculations by which they will determine if they are required to notify their interest in, or a change to their interest in, the Company under the FCA's Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules.

In accordance with Article 5(1)(b) of the UK version of Regulation (EU) No. 596/2014, which is part of UK law by virtue of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018, the table below contains detailed information of the individual trades made by Panmure Liberum as part of the Programme.

data.title: Brazil creates more formal jobs than expected in September
data.description:
Brazil's economy created 213,002 net formal jobs in September, data from the Labor Ministry showed on Thursday, above the 180,750 expected by economists in a Reuters poll.

The figure accounts for 2,292,492 jobs opened and 2,079,490 closed during the month, the ministry said.

It was the highest monthly net formal job creation in Brazil since April, although down 15.6% from September 2024, adjusted data showed.

From January to September, Brazil created 1,716,600 net jobs, down from 1,995,164 in the same period of 2024, according to adjusted data released by the Labor Ministry.

data.title: Vontier Corp SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Vontier Corp, a global industrial technology company, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights the company's financial and operational performance, showcasing steady growth in sales and operating profit, alongside strategic business initiatives aimed at enhancing productivity and expanding market reach.

Financial Highlights

Vontier Corp reported the following key financial metrics for the three and nine months ended September 26, 2025:

  • Sales: $752.5 million for the three months ended September 26, 2025, representing a slight increase from $750.0 million in the comparable period in 2024. For the nine months ended September 26, 2025, sales were $2,267.1 million, up from $2,202.2 million in the comparable period in 2024.
  • Operating Profit: $142.4 million for the three months ended September 26, 2025, an increase from $131.5 million in the comparable period in 2024. For the nine months ended September 26, 2025, operating profit was $408.9 million, up from $387.7 million in the comparable period in 2024.
  • Net Earnings: $102.8 million for the three months ended September 26, 2025, compared to $91.8 million in the comparable period in 2024. For the nine months ended September 26, 2025, net earnings were $282.6 million, down from $298.7 million in the comparable period in 2024.
  • Basic Net Earnings Per Share: $0.70 for the three months ended September 26, 2025, compared to $0.60 in the comparable period in 2024. For the nine months ended September 26, 2025, basic net earnings per share were $1.91, compared to $1.94 in the comparable period in 2024.
  • Diluted Net Earnings Per Share: $0.70 for the three months ended September 26, 2025, compared to $0.60 in the comparable period in 2024. For the nine months ended September 26, 2025, diluted net earnings per share were $1.90, compared to $1.93 in the comparable period in 2024.

Business Highlights

Vontier Corp's business performance for the three months ended September 26, 2025, is highlighted by the following operational metrics and strategic initiatives:

  • Revenue Segments:
    • The Mobility Technologies segment saw a 5.1% increase in total sales, driven by a 4.8% increase in core sales due to strong demand for convenience retail payment and enterprise productivity solutions.
    • The Repair Solutions segment experienced a 6.9% decrease in total and core sales, attributed to reduced volume in tool storage, diagnostics, and hardline product categories due to macroeconomic impacts on service technicians' discretionary spending.
    • The Environmental & Fueling Solutions segment reported a 2.3% increase in total sales, with a 1.8% increase in core sales driven by growth in aftermarket products.
  • Geographical Performance:
    • North America, including the United States, remains a significant market, contributing $542.2 million in sales. The region continues to be a key driver of the company's revenue.
    • High growth markets, including Eastern Europe, the Middle East, Africa, Latin America, and Asia Pacific, contributed $105.6 million in sales, reflecting the company's strategic focus on expanding in developing regions.
  • Future Outlook: The company expects core sales to increase year-over-year in 2025, with a focus on navigating challenges such as changes in trade policies, global supply chain conditions, and geopolitical conflicts.
  • Operational Efficiency:
    • The company has implemented productivity initiatives that resulted in a decrease in SG&A expenses by 3.8%, contributing to improved operating margins.
    • R&D expenses decreased by 2.8% due to focus and prioritization process initiatives, indicating a strategic approach to managing research and development costs.
  • Segment Performance:
    • Mobility Technologies segment operating profit increased by 7.5%, driven by cost optimization and increased volume.
    • Environmental & Fueling Solutions segment operating profit increased by 1.4%, despite a slight decrease in operating profit margin due to unfavorable product and geographic mix.

SEC Filing: Vontier Corp [ VNT ] - 10-Q - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: SERVICE CORP INTERNATIONAL SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Service Corp International, a leading provider of deathcare products and services, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report provides a comprehensive overview of the company's financial and operational performance, showcasing both growth and areas of strategic focus.

Financial Highlights

  • Total Revenue: $1,058.1 million, reflecting a 4.3% increase from the prior year period, driven by higher cemetery revenue.
  • Gross Profit: $265.5 million, an increase from $252.6 million in the prior year, indicating improved profitability.
  • Operating Income: $226.4 million, up from $212.4 million, supported by lower corporate general and administrative expenses.
  • Net Income: $117.5 million, slightly down from $117.8 million, impacted by lower funeral gross profit and a higher tax rate.
  • Diluted EPS: $0.83, consistent with the prior year, reflecting stable earnings per share despite a decrease in net income.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments: Funeral revenue for the three months ended September 30, 2025, was $574.1 million, with a slight increase from the previous year. Cemetery revenue also saw an increase, reaching $484.0 million for the same period.
  • Geographical Performance: The United States contributed significantly to the company's revenue, with $1,010.1 million for the three months ended September 30, 2025. Canada, while smaller in contribution, added $47.9 million to the total revenue.
  • Sales Units: The company performed 82,057 comparable funeral services in the third quarter of 2025, a decrease from 84,645 services in the same period of 2024. The average revenue per service increased to $5,852.
  • New Product Launches: The company continues to focus on developing additional memorialization merchandise and services that appeal to cremation customers, enhancing revenue opportunities.
  • Future Outlook: The company aims to leverage its strong market position and extensive network to capture future market share through preneed sales, which are expected to add stability and predictability to revenue and cash flows.

SEC Filing: SERVICE CORP INTERNATIONAL [ SCI ] - 10-Q - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: Align Technology Is Maintained at Equal-Weight by Morgan Stanley
Renasant Raised to Outperform From Market Perform by Hovde Group
